# Monitoring scopes


## Scope distribution (EU)

- Operationaliation distribution: 
  - Presence/absence in Flanders in $10\times 10$ km grid cells
  
- Use of 'distribution information' under EU Habitat directive
  - Deduced information: range ('outer limits of the species distribution')
    - Via spatial interpolation algorithm ('gap closure') & habitat information
  - Quantification: size of surface area of range
  - Status
    - Size in $km^2$ at time point / over time period
  - Trends
    - Short-term and long-term trends in size of range (2 vs. 4 reporting periods)
    - Direction, magnitude (% change) 

::: {.notes}

- wat gebeurt met verspreidingsinformatie - kijken naar habitatrichtlijn
- range als spatiale generalisatie
- periode status dan max. de laatste rapporteringsperiode
- trends: short-term dus 12 jaar, long-term 24 jaar

:::

## Scope abundance (EU)

- Optional, in the context of management evaluation
- EU Habitat Directive:
  - Information: Number of mature individuals 
  - Quantification: Absolute size 
  - Status: Size at time point / over time period
  - Trends
    - Short-term and long-term trends in size
    - Direction, magnitude (% change) 
  - Scale: Flanders ('biogeographical region' of species)  


::: {.notes}
- population is defined as the set of individuals of a species present in a 'biogeographical region within Flanders
- total distribution area?
:::

## Scope abundance (EU/Flanders)

- Specification required...
  - Operationalization (e.g., number of mature individuals)?
  - Quantification (e.g., relative vs. absolute size)?
  - Definition status & trend?
  - Scale of statements (e.g., Flanders vs. local)?
  - Input data (e.g., structured vs. opportunistic)?

::: {.notes}
- local scale selected areas: e.g., invasion hotspot, area of management
- scale: if species is managed than rather at scale of managed area (see next slides; distinct meetnet)
- schaal: abundance monitoring *kan* ook provide information on distribution (conditions)
- input data: voorbeeld heat maps op basis van ad-hoc data (geschatte dichtheden)?

:::


## Scope distribution/abundance under management (EU/Flanders)


- Cf. scope distribution/abundance
  - Similiar specifications required
- Evaluation of management happens along continuum: 
  - Endpoint 1: determining a causal effect of a measure
  - Endpoint 2: evaluating temporal and spatial correlates of management
    - Much more feasible & we suggest to focus on this


::: {.notes}
- 'under management':
  - continuum from determining a causal effect of a measure to evaluating temporal and spatial correlates (assuming some causal effect of a measure)
  - we will probably rather be close to the latter end than the former
- EU: Evaluatie maatregelen
  - Doeltreffendheid: effect op aanwezigheid en/of aantallen
  - Neveneffecten op habitat / niet-doelsoorten

:::



## Scope distribution/abundance under management (EU/Flanders)

- Eradication
  - Evaluation: confirm absence
  - Limited in space and time: 
    - Confined area of management with confined follow-up period

::: {.notes}

- Eradication:
  - Rate of eradication not of primary interest
  - Rather confirm absence after eradication has taken place

:::


## Scope distribution/abundance under management (EU/Flanders)

- Distribution containment
  - Evaluation: confirm status and/or trend of size of distribution area contained
  - Limited in space, but not time:
    - Within confined area of management
    - Continued measurement
- Population control
  - Evaluation: confirm status and/or trend of size of population under control 
  - Limited in space, but not time
    - Within confined area of management
    - Continued measurement

::: {.notes}

- Containment/Control:
  - onder drempel?
  - misschien trend onder drempel ook al interessant om vroegtijdig te kunnen reageren?
  - (cf. early warning lit.)


:::


## Scope distribution/abundance under management (EU/Flanders)

- Specification required...
  - Information to evaluate management (distribution vs. abundance)?
  - Operationalization?
  - Quantification? 
    - Binary (e.g., presence-absence, below threshold)?
    - Continuous (e.g., sub-threshold trend)?
  - Definition status & trend?
  - Time frame of evaluation (if eradication)?
  - Area of evaluation (e.g., buffer area)?
  - How to assess side effects on habitat/species?

Belangrijke vragen hier ...
Binary -> informatie wordt dan weer gereduceerd
Neveneffecten op habitat / niet-doelsoorten

:::

## Scope detection (EU/Flanders)

- Presence in defined area
  - Around known (potential) places of introduction and sites of sporadic occurrence
  - possibly also in/around conservation area
- Analogies with scope distribution


::: {.notes}
- in/around conservation area: 
  - in conservation area
  - periphery of conservation area
  - buffer area around conservation area
- analogies with scope distribution
  - area divided into grid cells/resolution in terms of grid cells
  - certain search effort required

:::

## Scope detection (EU/Flanders)

- Specification required...
  - Operationalization (e.g., presence/absence in grid cells)?
  - Scale of statements (e.g., Flanders vs. local)?
  - Area of detection (e.g., known introduction sites, conservation area, buffer area)?
  - Input data (e.g., structured vs. opportunistic)?
